    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"

>
[Scroll Trickster Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2053) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 189 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Scroll Trickster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=74)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), Trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11), or Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)

</column>

---

You've studied [scrolls](/equipment/consumables/scrolls) in depth. This might have been a comprehensive education in formal setting, or the sort of education where you somehow obtain a number of scrolls and try not to explode anything you didn't mean to explode. You gain the [Trick Magic Item](/Feats.aspx?ID=857) feat, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to skill checks to Trick scrolls. If you roll a critical failure to Trick a Magic Item that's a scroll, you get a failure instead.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the scroll trickster archetype.

<title level="2">Scroll Trickster Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Scroll Cache](/Feats.aspx?ID=2054), [Skim Scroll](/Feats.aspx?ID=2055)
